references.paper_title: Channel polarization: A method for constructing capacity-achieving codes for symmetric binary-input memoryless channels
references.reason: This paper introduced polar codes, a family of capacity-achieving codes that are central to the proposed channel simulation scheme, PolarSim.

references.paper_title: Unified scaling of polar codes: Error exponent, scaling exponent, moderate deviations, and error floors
references.reason: This paper provides crucial theoretical guarantees on the performance of polar codes, which are used to justify the optimality claims for the proposed PolarSim scheme.

references.paper_title: Strong functional representation lemma and applications to coding theorems
references.reason: This paper establishes important theoretical bounds on the rate of channel simulation, which are used as benchmarks to evaluate the efficiency of PolarSim.
This book is a foundational text in information theory, providing the theoretical background and context for the channel simulation problem and various coding techniques.
This paper presents prior work on channel simulation, establishing a baseline performance and complexity that the new proposed scheme aims to improve upon.
